text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with grilled sea bass with an Asian
chili lime dressing that's right this
takes almost as long to say as it does
to make and we get so many food wishes
this time of year for super fast easy
grill recipes and this is like the
epitome of that and while it is very
super fast and easy it doesn't taste our
look super fast and easy so your guests
will be impressed and it'll be our
little secret all right
so let me show you how to put this
together step one we're going to make
the dressing so in a glass bowl I'm
going to add some very very finely
minced or crushed garlic and by the way
I did not use a knife on that garlic I
just used the microplane
all right the fine grater that I was
about to use for this lime zest which is
the next ingredient
so we're going to do some freshly grated
lime zest and then of course we need
some chili it's in the name so a big
spoon of sambal that's a crushed red
chili sauce you know we love that stuff
around here so big spoon of that I'm
going to squeeze in the juice of one
lime and yes if you want to use lemon
use lime and of course you can why do
people ask those questions
oh is a mystery you're the Commish of
your fish use whatever you want all
right after the lime juice I'm going to
add a big splash of seasoned rice
vinegar and a couple tablespoons of fish
sauce which I believe is made from
fermented fish all right that fish sauce
is going to give us some very important
saltiness and a little bit of funkiness
and not bad funkiness like old fish I'm
talking good funkiness like James Brown
if you're scared or can't find it you
could just use a little soy sauce to
taste and then last but not least a
little bit of toasted sesame oil and
people always say that's going to give
it a little bit of nuttiness it's not
it's a seed it's going to give it a
little bit of seediness
actually you know what we should just
stick with nuttiness so I'm gonna take
my freakishly small wooden spoon and
give that a stir and we could just set
that aside until our fish or whatever
protein we're serving this with is done
and for me I have some beautiful pieces
of sea bass all right this is not the
naughty one this is the sustainable one
and to prep that for the grill I'm just
going to brush out a little bit of
vegetable oil a tiny bit and a nice
sprinkling of salt
all right 95% of the seasoning is in
that dressing but we do want a little
bit of salt and I did that to both sides
I only show you one because of your
imaginations and I'm going to cook that
on a charcoal grill over high heat for
about three or four minutes per side and
you people having trouble grilling
food you want to get these big thick
wide cast iron grates the food tends not
to stick as much you're going to get
beautiful grill marks and it just makes
whatever you're grilling much easier to
work with and of course fish being a
little more delicate than something like
a steak
I didn't bother doing the extra turn for
the diamond shaped grill marks I don't
have anything to prove I got the job
but if you want to do the diamond marks
go ahead I think this looks great just
like this so like I said I grilled mine
for about three minutes per side a
couple pieces were a little bigger I
left those out a little longer and I
just go by feel when the meat springs
back it's usually done if it feels mushy
its raw and if it's overcooked it'll
feel hard and dry so don't let it go
that far but right there mine was
perfect I'm going to pull that off and
you don't need to let it rest we want to
put this dressing over the fish warm so
give it a quick whisking make sure it's
all thoroughly combined and then put
your fish on some kind of serving
platter and take a spoon and drizzle
over that incredibly simple yet
explosively flavorful sauce and by the
way this is one of those recipes where
if you don't like how it comes out it's
totally your fault you want it a little
sweeter put in a pinch of sugar all
right you want it more tart use more
lime or more vinegar throw in some more
spice if you want if you wanted a little
saltier add some soy and so forth so
taste your dressing and make it
delicious before you spoon it over your
fish and you know it's going to rock and
once we've applied that beautiful chili
lime dressing I'm gonna finish with some
nice cilantro leaves all right I just
picked those and gave them a rough chop
it's almost like a little salad on top
and that is done grilled sea bass with
Asian chili lime dressing I serve mine
with some caramelized parsnips just to
be different and they were incredible
with this dressing as well you can see
there that beautiful juicy fish and that
tart citrusy spicy dressing just a hint
of sweetness from the rice vinegar just
a beautiful thing which is why this is
one of my all-time favorite go-to warm
weather recipes it's just never not
fantastic you can do this with all sorts
of different seafood shellfish chicken
pork etc it's infinitely adaptable
there's no end to the combinations you
could use here for flavorings and
seasonings so I really do hope you give
this a try head over to food wishes comm
for all the ingredient amounts
and Marco as usual and as always enjoy
